critique: This executive order by George W. Bush aims to guide federal agencies in formulating policies that involve faith-based and community organizations. It emphasizes equal protection and expanding opportunities for these organizations to meet social needs. The order addresses non-discrimination in service provision, allows religious expression in organizational identity, and promotes data collection on faith-based organizations' participation in federal programs. It also amends Executive Order 11246 to prevent unwarranted exclusion of faith-based organizations from federal contracts.
